intro: Erigeron lineatus, commonly known as the slender fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as meadows, prairies, and disturbed soils, and it thrives in full sun. Its linear leaves and small white or pale yellow flowers make it easily recognizable. Erigeron lineatus is often used in native plant gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
